name: places/ChIJYSjtGB9awokRvtwfGw4UEpc
formattedAddress: 95 W Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 95 W Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA

editorialSummary.text: Buzzy Tribeca hotel offering snug, stylish rooms with free Wi-Fi, plus a modern Italian restaurant.

originalText.text:
A remarkable hotel in an excellent location in TriBeCa. We were a little disappointed with the check-in experience which, after a long flight, was cold and impersonal to say the least and left us feeling a bit deflated.

Thankfully the service we received gratefully improved and we were made up overall with our two nights. I would certainly stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to our friends and family.

text.text:

Thankfully the service we received gratefully improved and we were made up overall with our two nights. I would certainly stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to our friends and family.

originalText.text:
My friend and I booked this hotel to enjoy a meet-up in NYC. We loved the decor, the room aesthetic, location, and the privacy of this hotel. Also, if you get up early enough you get an awesome complimentary breakfast.

Our room was very dark and moody and perfect for rest...or so we thought. Beware room 206, our room was right above the lounge, which they failed to mention or warn us about. We found out due to a private event that was booked for our first night, also not mentioned.

I kid you not the music started, STARTED at 11PM on a Thursday, and it was so loud it was like we were in the middle of the dance floor. We called down to the desk 2x and loathed being "those people," and 2x we were told, "Oh, it will be over in 30 minutes." My friend and I waited with pained hope that the music would stop, but continue it did. Eventually, the horrible DJ died down, and being so fatigued from travel we passed out.

Do not accept room 206 if you care to sleep, or at least get in writing that there's no private event or special club night if you do. I wish there had been a review like this so we could have happily switched beforehand. You've been warned. ✨️

originalText.text: This is the second time my dear old friend of 30 years and I have met and stayed here midway between our homes. The rooms are a speck small, but understandable in an old NYC hotel. They are clean, comfortable, and well-appointed! The location is great — in Tribecca — for walking, eating, drinking, etc.  We recommend the short walk to the AIre water circuit spa — absolutely divine!!

originalText.text:
Location of the hotel is really lovely
The rooms are ok ... nothing special.. quite basic for the price that you pay.

Bathroom was tiny (well decorated though), and only had a rain shower, which meant that it was quite difficult to shower without getting your hair wet.

Doormen were super helpful and lovely, however, reception staff a little bit cold.

originalText.text:
I stayed at the Frederick for two nights, Thursday night and Friday night. I really enjoyed my experience on Thursday; the hotel is so charming, the staff member that checked me in was incredibly friendly, the room was comfortable and had everything I needed, and the free breakfast at the Serafina was awesome. The coffee was particularly good! However, on Friday night my experience was sadly ruined. There was loud music playing from what I can only assume is the hotel's bar, and the music didn't stop until 1:30 AM in the morning. I could not get any sleep at all! Because of that, I ended up sleeping in and missing the hotel's free breakfast on Saturday morning. It was a tragedy and my experience was really ruined because of the ridiculous loud music. It had lots of bass too, so even when I couldn't hear it I could feel the vibrations throughout the room.

I was on the second floor in room 226 which I'm guessing is right above the bar. If I were to stay here again I would probably ignore the 2nd floor completely and try to have a room on the upper floors, but because of this experience I'd probably look at other hotels before choosing this one again. It was a shame because if I were able to get some sleep this hotel would have been 5 stars without hesitation.
